abstracts.cdata!:
The Education System Realignment and
            Strengthening Program Project, will improve the quality, and
            relevance of primary, and general secondary learning
            outcomes, by better preparing students to meet the demands
            of a market economy within a democratic society. The project
            components will: 1) develop, and implement an outcome-based
            national curriculum for primary, and general secondary
            education, which should include the development of a
            national assessment/examinations system. Technical
            assistance (TA) will be provided to realign the national
            curriculum, and assessment system, to design, train, and
            develop teacher training materials, and, to improve textbook
            quality. Additionally, office equipment, resource centers,
            and materials to establish a textbook rental, and monitoring
            system will be financed; 2) strengthen the management
            capacity at central, and local levels, through the
            development, and implementation of policies to improve the
            financial, human, and physical resource management. TA, and
            training in education policy development, analysis and
            management, teacher incentives, education finance, and
            organizational development will be financed, and, office
            equipment, and furniture provided; and, 3) TA, and training
            will be financed to support project management, to include
            procurement, financial management and disbursement, and key
            software programs, such as financial accounting packages.
